page.title: 13Edgmond Village
page.content: The historic village of Edgmond overlooking Newport on the west side has a{population}of 1,800.Although the village has expanded greatly in recent years the other parts reman unchanged. There are many long-standing residents with memories of village life in the past. Much of the presant life of the village revolves around the church of St. Peter, which celabrated it's 900th anniversary in 1980. Old{customs ,such the "clipping" of the church on St. Peter's day ,are still very much alive. The village hall provides a centre for such activities as W.I., Guides, Brownies, Senior Social Club, Playgroup, The Cricket field is nearby. Edgmond has one shop, a post office, 2 garages, a Methodist and a C.of E. church and 2 pubs,the Lion and the Lamb. Local children attend the school of St. Peters by the church.
